verses.kjv: And the famine was sore in the land.
verses.ct: The famine continued to be severe throughout the land.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
verses.ct: When they had used up all the grain they brought back from Egypt, their father told them, "Go back and buy us some more food."

verses.kjv: And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
verses.ct: Judah spoke up and said, "The man warned us very clearly, 'You will not be allowed in my presence unless your brother is with you.'"

verses.kjv: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
verses.ct: "If you send our brother along with us, we'll go down and buy food for you."

verses.kjv: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
verses.ct: "But if you won't send him, we're not going. The man told us plainly, 'You will not be allowed in my presence unless your brother is with you.'"

verses.kjv: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
verses.ct: Israel said, "Why did you cause me such trouble by telling the man you had another brother?"

verses.kjv: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
verses.ct: They replied, "The man questioned us thoroughly about our family, asking, 'Is your father still alive? Do you have another brother?' We simply answered his questions. How could we possibly have known he would demand, 'Bring your brother here'?"

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
verses.ct: Then Judah said to his father Israel, "Send the boy with me, and we'll leave right away. That way we can all survive and not starve — us, you, and our children too."

verses.kjv: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
verses.ct: "I personally guarantee his safety. Hold me responsible for him. If I don't bring him back and place him right in front of you, let me carry the blame for the rest of my life."

verses.kjv: For except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time.
verses.ct: "If we hadn't wasted so much time, we could have made the trip twice by now."

verses.kjv: And their father Israel said unto them, If it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:
verses.ct: Their father Israel finally said to them, "If that's how it has to be, then do this: pack some of the finest products of the land in your bags and bring them as a gift for the man — some balm, some honey, spices, myrrh, pistachios, and almonds."

verses.kjv: And take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight:
verses.ct: "Take twice the amount of silver with you, and return the silver that was put back in your sacks. Maybe it was a mistake."

verses.kjv: Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
verses.ct: "Take your brother too, and go back to the man right away."

verses.kjv: And God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may send away your other brother, and Benjamin. If I be bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.
verses.ct: "May God Almighty cause the man to show you mercy, so that he releases your other brother and Benjamin. As for me, if I must lose my children, then I must lose them."

verses.kjv: And the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
verses.ct: So the men gathered the gifts, took double the silver, and brought Benjamin with them. They headed down to Egypt and presented themselves to Joseph.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, Bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men shall dine with me at noon.
verses.ct: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he told his house manager, "Take these men to my home. Butcher an animal and prepare a meal, because these men will eat lunch with me at noon."

verses.kjv: And the man did as Joseph bade; and the man brought the men into Joseph’s house.
verses.ct: The manager did exactly as Joseph instructed and brought the men to Joseph's house.

verses.kjv: And the men were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph’s house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.
verses.ct: The men became frightened when they were taken to Joseph's house. They said to each other, "It's because of the silver that was returned in our sacks the first time. He's looking for an excuse to attack us, make us slaves, and take our donkeys."

verses.kjv: And they came near to the steward of Joseph’s house, and they communed with him at the door of the house,
verses.ct: So they approached Joseph's house manager and spoke to him at the doorway.

verses.kjv: And said, O sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
verses.ct: "Sir," they said, "we came down the first time specifically to buy food."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man’s money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
verses.ct: "When we stopped for the night and opened our sacks, each man's silver was right there at the top of his sack — the full amount. We've brought it all back with us."

verses.kjv: And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.
verses.ct: "We've also brought additional silver to buy food. We have no idea who put our silver back in our sacks."

verses.kjv: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.
verses.ct: He replied, "Relax, don't worry about it. Your God, the God of your father, must have placed treasure in your sacks. I received your payment." Then he brought Simeon out to them.

verses.kjv: And the man brought the men into Joseph’s house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
verses.ct: The manager led the men into Joseph's house, gave them water to wash their feet, and provided feed for their donkeys.

verses.kjv: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
verses.ct: They prepared their gifts for Joseph's arrival at noon, since they had been told they would be eating there.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth.
verses.ct: When Joseph arrived home, they presented the gifts they had brought into the house and bowed down to the ground before him.

verses.kjv: And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?
verses.ct: He asked how they were doing, then said, "How is your elderly father you told me about? Is he still alive?"

verses.kjv: And they answered, Thy servant our father is in good health, he is yet alive. And they bowed down their heads, and made obeisance.
verses.ct: They answered, "Your servant, our father, is in good health. He is still alive." Then they bowed low in respect.

verses.kjv: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and said, Is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.
verses.ct: Joseph looked up and saw his brother Benjamin, his own mother's son, and asked, "Is this your youngest brother you told me about?" Then he said to Benjamin, "May God be gracious to you, my son."

verses.kjv: And Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
verses.ct: Joseph hurried out because he was overwhelmed with emotion for his brother. He found a private room and cried there.

verses.kjv: And he washed his face, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, Set on bread.
verses.ct: After washing his face, he came back out and composed himself. Then he said, "Serve the meal."

verses.kjv: And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
verses.ct: They served Joseph at his own table, the brothers at a separate table, and the Egyptians who were eating with him at yet another table, because Egyptians considered it offensive to eat with Hebrews.

verses.kjv: And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one at another.
verses.ct: The brothers were seated facing him in order from the oldest to the youngest, and they looked at each other in amazement.

verses.kjv: And he took and sent messes unto them from before him: but Benjamin’s mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with him.
verses.ct: Joseph had portions of food sent to them from his own table, but Benjamin's portion was 5 times larger than anyone else's. They drank and celebrated with him.
